pull.title: doc: Mention that BerkeleyDB is for legacy wallet in build-unix
pull.body:
This updates build-unix for the descriptor wallet, and prepares for eventual legacy wallet deprecation.

- Move 'descriptor wallet' dependencies above legacy wallet deps both for Debian and Fedora.
- Explicitly mention 'legacy wallet' where referring to the BerkeleyDB wallet. Shorten BerkeleyDB instruction to a single paragraph.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
doc: Mention that BerkeleyDB is for legacy wallet in build-unix

This updates build-unix for the descriptor wallet, and prepares for
eventual legacy wallet deprecation.

- Move 'descriptor wallet' dependencies above legacy wallet deps both
for Debian and Fedora.
- Explicitly mention 'legacy wallet' where referring to the BerkeleyDB
wallet. Shorten BerkeleyDB instruction to a single paragraph.

events.body: Concept ACK and thank you very much.
ACK 7eb5b25e6ec790577f84f48942c9e8791dec8697, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,19 +85,15 @@ Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](/depends/README.md) or in
 
     sudo apt-get install libevent-dev libboost-dev libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-test-dev
 
-Berkeley DB is required for the wallet.
-
-Ubuntu and Debian have their own `libdb-dev` and `libdb++-dev` packages, but these will install
-Berkeley DB 5.1 or later. This will break binary wallet compatibility with the distributed executables, which
-are based on BerkeleyDB 4.8. If you do not care about wallet compatibility,
-pass `--with-incompatible-bdb` to configure.
-
-Otherwise, you can build Berkeley DB [yourself](#berkeley-db).
-
 SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
 
     sudo apt install libsqlite3-dev
 
+Berkeley DB is required for the legacy wallet. Ubuntu and Debian have their own `libdb-dev` and `libdb++-dev` packages,

@@ -85,19 +85,15 @@ Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](/depends/README.md) or in
 
     sudo apt-get install libevent-dev libboost-dev libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-test-dev
 
-Berkeley DB is required for the wallet.
-
-Ubuntu and Debian have their own `libdb-dev` and `libdb++-dev` packages, but these will install
-Berkeley DB 5.1 or later. This will break binary wallet compatibility with the distributed executables, which
-are based on BerkeleyDB 4.8. If you do not care about wallet compatibility,
-pass `--with-incompatible-bdb` to configure.
-
-Otherwise, you can build Berkeley DB [yourself](#berkeley-db).
-
 SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
 
     sudo apt install libsqlite3-dev
 
+Berkeley DB is required for the legacy wallet. Ubuntu and Debian have their own `libdb-dev` and `libdb++-dev` packages,
comments.body: s/"Ubuntu and Debian"/"Debian, Ubuntu and other Debian-based systems"/
